titleStmt.title: Quæstiones in sacra theologia discutiendæ Oxonii in vesperiis sexto die Iulii, anno Dom. 1639
titleStmt.author: University of Oxford.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the University of Oxford. Archives.

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,363 texts created during Phase 1 of the project have been released into the public domain as of 1 January 2015. Anyone can now take and use these texts for their own purposes, but we respectfully request that due credit and attribution is given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

revisionDesc.change: 2007-10 AptaraKeyed and coded from ProQuest page images
2008-04 Mona LogarboText and markup reviewed and edited

div.head: QVAESTIONES IN SACRA THEOLOGIA DISCUTIENDAE OXONII IN VESPERIIS SEXTO Die Iulii. Anno Dom. 1639.
Quaeſtiones IASPARI FISCHER Inceptoris è Coll. Mag.
div.p:
An
Ratio Naturalis contradicat veritati Theologicae? Neg.
Theologia viatorum ſit ſcientia practica? Aff.
Sanctitas vitae ſit ex Notis Eccleſiae? Aff.

div.head: Quaeſtiones SAM. BERNARD Inceptoris è Coll. Mag.
div.p:
An
Magiſtratus civilis competat Eccleſiaſticis? Aff.
Conjugium repugnet ſacris Ordinibus? Neg.
Perſolum Chriſtum ſit quaerenda ſalus? Aff.

div.head: Quaeſtiones THO. BUCKNER Inceptoris è Coll. Mag.
div.p:
An
Abſ
que interventu Chriſti ſatisfactionis Deus condonet peccata reſipiſcentibus? Neg.
Scriptura ipſa à noſtris Theologis verè & aptè Iudex fidei vocetur? Aff.
Verbo Dei concedatur principi ſumma omnium ſuorum ſubditorum Gubernatio in Eccleſiae Cauſis? Aff.

div.head: Quaeſt. IOHANNIS OLIVER Incept. è Coll. Mag.
div.p:
An
Pontifex Romanus ſit caput Eccleſiae univerſalis? Neg.
Romana fides ſit Regula fidei Catholicae? Neg.
Ritus externi ſint ſub poteſtate Eccleſiae? Aff.

div.head: Quaeſt. THO. WYKES Incept. è Coll. D. Ioan. Bap.
div.p:
An
Cultus Religioſus ſoli Deo debeatur? Aff.
Dominium temporale fundetur in Gratiâ? Neg.
Rex in Regno ſuo ſit ſolo Deo minor? Aff.

div.head: Quaeſt. AARONIS WILSON Incept. è Coll. Reg.
div.p:
An
Merè Ceremonialia ſint in Scripturis revelata? Neg.
In diverſis Eccleſiis diverſae poſſint eſſe Ceremoniae? Aff.
Eccleſia Anglicana rectè obliget ad Ceremonias? Aff.

div.head: Quaeſt. IOSEPHI HENSHAWE Incept. ex Aulâ Mag.
div.p:
An
Obedientia debeatur Eccleſiae in rebus mediis? Aff.
Iuramentum ad rem illicitam ſit obligatorium? Neg.
Commixtio peccatorum in Eccleſiâ aliquâ, ſit juſta cauſa ſeparandi? Neg.

div.head: Quaeſt. HOPTONI SIDENHAM Incept. è Coll. Mag.
div.p:
An
Omnia contineantur in Scripturis quae ſunt neceſſaria ad Salutem? Aff.
Sola Scriptura ſit Norma in Controverſiis fidei dirimendis? Aff.
Haeretici quâ Haeretici ſint morte mulctandi? Neg.

div.head: Quaeſt. THO. TEMPLE Incept. è Coll. Linc.
div.p:
An
Scripturae aſſignent aliam Salutis rationem praeter fidem? Neg.
Vera fides poſſit ſeparari à bonis operibus? Neg.
Dentur Fundamentalia in ſe neceſſariò credenda? Aff.

div.head: Quaeſt. HEN. HAMMON Incept. è Coll. Mag.
div.p:
An
Conditio novi foederis ſit ad ſalutem indiſpenſabilitèr praeſtanda? Aff.
Tranſubſtantiatio ſit poſſibilis? Neg.
Deceat Euchariſtiam publicè celebrari ſine offertorio? Neg.

div.head: Quaeſt. BRUNI RYVES Incept. è Coll. Mag.
div.p:
An
Dominium & ſervitus ſub Evangelio ſint licita? Aff.
Lex Civilis obliget in Conſcientia? Aff.
Impius excidat Dominio? Neg.

div.head: Quaeſt. NICHOLAI GIBBON Incept. ex Aulâ St Edmundi.
div.p:
An
Iuſtitia originalis fuit Adamo naturalis? Aff.
Lapſus Adami introduxit peccatum originale? Aff.
Detur perfectio in hâc vitâ? Neg.

div.head: Quaeſt. GUALT. CLARKE Incept. è Coll. Mag.
div.p:
An Scriptura
Sit optimus Interpres Scripturae? Aff.
Laicis ſit Legenda? Aff.
Teſtetur dari Purgatorium? Neg.

div.head: QUAESTIONES IN JURE CIVILI DISCVTIENDAE IN VESPERIIS,
Quaest. THO. LLOYD Incept. è Coll. D. Joan. Bap.
div.p:
An
Res publici Iuris poſſint alienari? Neg.
Semel Aedes ſacra facta locus ſacer maneat etiam diruto Aedificio? Aff.
Res pignorata debeat eſſe in Bonis Debitoris obligationis tempore? Aff.

div.head: Quaeſt. HARBERTI PELHAM Incept. è Coll. Mag.
div.p:
An
Mandans fieri delictum puniatur eâdem paenâ quâ delinquens? Aff.
Teſtis non Iuratus falſum deponens teneatur paenâ falſi? Aff.
Teſtis pecuniâ corruptus etiamſi verum dixerit ſit puniendus? Aff.

div.head: Quaeſt. IOH. NICHOLSON Incept. è Coll. Magd.
div.p:
An
Reus Actori teneatur edere inſtrumenta? Neg.
Creditor poſſit cogi ad partem debiti accipiendam? Neg.
Matrimonium ſine conſenſu parentum contractum valeat? Neg.

div.head: QUAESTIONES IN MEDICINA DISCVTIEND AE IN VESPERIIS.
Quaest. IOH. EDWARDS Incept. è Coll. Div. Joan.
div.p:
An
Caena debeat eſſe liberalior quam Prandium? Aff.
Varietas Ciborum conducat ad ſanitatem? Neg.
Panis Azymus ſit inſalubrior fermentato? Aff.

div.head: Quaeſt. THO. CLAYTON Incept. è Coll. Pemb.
div.p:
An
Venae ſanguificent? Aff.
Mentis morbo laborans poſſit eſſe corpore ſanus? Neg.
Medicamenta ſint cum Alimentis exhibenda? Neg.

div.head: Quaeſt. IOAN. AUBREY Incept. è Coll. Magd.
div.p:
An
Similitudo natorum faciat praeſumere filiationem? Neg.
Deplorati ſolis prognoſticis ſint relinquendi? Neg.
Praecipuum incubi ſubjectum ſit cerebrum? Aff.

div.head: QVAESTIONES IN PHILOSOPHIA DISCVTIEND AE IN VESPERIIS.
div.p:
An
Anima quae in ſomno deprimitur in extaſi elevetur? Aff.
Notitiae communes quae ex inſtinctu naturali proveniunt à ſeipſis fidem vendicent? Aff.
Orbes inferiores circūagantur motu diurno ad impulſum primi mobilis? Aff.
Respondente Incept. FRAN. POWEL. A. M. ex Aede Ch.

div.head: QVAESTIONES IN S. THEOLOGIA DISCVTIEND AE IN COMIITIS. 8o. Die Iulij, Anno Dom. 1639.
div.p:
An
Eccleſia Romana ſit infallibilis? Neg.
Eccleſia Anglicana cenſenda ſit Schiſmatis rea? Neg.
Ad Civilem Magiſtratum pertineat Indictio Conciliorum? Aff.
Reſpondente HEN. HAMMON è Coll. Mag.

div.head: QVAESTIONES IN IVRE CIVILI DISCVTIEND AE IN COMITIIS.
div.p:
An
Liceat Bellum inferre in Infideles eo quod Infideles? Neg.
Legatus ſit puniendus à principe non ſuo? Neg.
Pater ſit quem nuptiae demonſtrant? Aff.
Reſpondente HEN. COVENTRY è Coll. Omnium Anim.

div.head: QVAESTIONES IN MEDICINA DISCVTIEND AE IN COMITIIS.
div.p:
An
In principio morborum liceat uti minorativo? Neg.
Diſſectio Cadaveris humani ſit inhumana? Neg.
In morbis perperacutis victus exactè tenuiſſimus conveniat? Aff.
Reſpondente TOBIA GARBRAND ex Aulâ Nov. Hoſp.

div.head: QVAESTIONES IN PHILOSOPHIA DISCVTIEND AE IN COMITIIS.
div.p:
An
Vehementioribus affectibus obnoxii ſint homines quam Bruta? Aff.
Aexsquivocatio ſit peſſimum mentiendi Artificium? Aff.
Corpus ſit Animi ſpeculum? Aff.
Reſpondente GUIL. MORGAN A. M. ex Aulâ Alban.
